newsitem.title: TANZANIA: Tanzania beefs up security in national parks.
newsitem.headline: Tanzania beefs up security in national parks.

text.p: Tanzania has sent 250 armed rangers to its Serengeti national park with orders to shoot bandits on sight, tourism officials said on Monday.
The order was given by Tourism Minister Juma Ngasongwa last week after a surge in attacks at tourist sites.
Other measures include a 24-hour radio network, patrols by helicopters and light aircraft and the hiring of a security expert from Zimbabwe to advise how best to combat the problem.

Heavily-armed bandits earlier this month ambushed 25 Italian and American tourists inside Serengeti, one of Africa's best-known game parks, shooting up two mini-buses and badly wounding two female tourists.
Three days later, gunmen posing as tourists shot dead a hotel cashier in the northern Tanzanian town of Arusha at the foot of Mount Meru, the gateway to many of Tanzania's top attractions.
